data.text: @kcjohnson9 @CathyYoung63 @arneduncan @megynkelly She's got "Gyn" in her name and she's still defending men. That's pretty dope
@kcjohnson9 @RobProvince @arneduncan @megynkelly Arnie Duncan........ wasn't he the real life inspiration for the Eddie Haskell character on "Leave It To Beaver?

@Vince524 The likeliest explanation is Duncan (who wasn't much involved w/this area of policy) went to Lhamon & asked whether they had ever done anything that might have been construed as defending due process. This was the best she could come up with,
@kcjohnson9 Yet there was never a further review to see what students may have been suspended or expelled but who lacked the means to litigate it.

@kcjohnson9 What’s more, colleges routinely defended their policies as being fair when it was showed to be lopsided. Unable to see charges, unable to question witnesses, etc. so unless you think some cases like Amherst or Denison were exceptions, then those policies stood in each case.

@kcjohnson9 Even if (and it’s implausible) he’s referring to the UVA’s that were admonished for failing accused students, it’s AFTER the schools have irreparably damaged people later found to be innocent.

@kcjohnson9 @arneduncan @megynkelly Arne Duncan had to call her out. Otherwise, his friends, family, associates, and all Democrats might have skinned him and hung him out upside down. 

Just another issue, I think, that bodes ill for Democrats come November.

Duncan's evidence for his inflammatory claim that Kelly "lied"? Not *anything* from the 2011 or 2014 guidance. No statement from Pres or VP (or him). No policy initiatives from OCR. Instead: two throwaway passages from resolutions of complaints filed by *accusers* agst 2 schools.
